IPolygon2

Defines a 2D polygon

Functions
GetNumberPoints
virtual uint32 GetNumberPoints() = 0

Returns the number of points in the polygon

GetPoint
virtual void GetPoint(
uint32 index,
Vector2 *pt
) = 0

Returns the requested point (by index)

Parameters

uint32

index of point to get

pt
Vector2*

Returns the found point

Vector2 &pt
) = 0

GetBBox
virtual void GetBBox(
BBox2 *pBBox
) = 0

Returns the 2D bounding box of the polygon

Parameters

Returns the polygon's bounding box

Simplify
virtual CRefObj<IPolygon2> Simplify(
float err,
float maxLen
) = 0

Removes points from a polygon that allow the resulting polygon to still be with 'err' units from the original polygon.  This function uses the Ramer-Douglas-Peucker algorithm:

https://​en​.wikipedia​.org​/wiki​/Ramer�Douglas�Peucker_algorithm

Parameters
err
float

Tolerance for deciding whether to remove a point

maxLen
float

Longest line segment allowed. If maxLen==0 then no limit.

Returns

Returns the new simplified polygon

ContainsPoint
virtual bool ContainsPoint(
Vector2 &pt,
float *pMinDist = nullptr,
float *pMaxDist = nullptr
) = 0

Determines whether the specified point is inside the polygon.

Parameters
pos

Point to rest

pMinDist
float*

Optional argument that returns the closest distance from the point to the polygon

pMaxDist
float*

Optional argument that returns the furthest distance from the point to the polygon (Hausdorff distance)
